snippet: Two-thirds of women said they faced retribution for reporting the sexual attacks, though two studies indicated a decline in such episodes over all.
abstract: Pentagon report finds number of sexual assaults in armed forces declined in 2014, but two-thirds of women in military say they faced retaliation for filing sexual assault complaints.
lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of women said they faced retribution for reporting the sexual attacks, though two studies indicated a decline in such episodes over all.

headline.main: Women in Military Cite Retaliation After Assault Complaints
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Looks at Retaliation for Reports of Sexual Assault

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
